page.title: 08ST.PETER'S CHURCH IN ANLABY
page.content: There has been a church on this site since 1865 although the present building dates from 1885. Apart from the usual services performed weekly and monthly in the church, weddings, baptisms and funerals also occur. The numbers involved so far this year (up to 12.7.85) are as follows: 14 weddings; 16 baptisms (12 boys, 4 girls); 30 funerals (13 men: youngest 62, oldest 86; 17 women: youngest 47, oldest 93). The church collects about Â£200 during its weekly services but has an annual expenditure of Â£17000. St. Peter's is busy throughout the week. Every day it is used by one or more of a variety of groups. These include brownies, guides, scouts and cubs as well as adults' clubs such as a fitness group, a needlework class and a companions club for the over 60's.
